Generation V.Black: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.
Generation V.White: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
Generation V.Black 2: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
Generation V.White 2: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.

Generation VI.X: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
Generation VI.Y: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.

Generation VII.Sun: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.
Generation VII.Moon: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Fishermen take them along on long voyages, because if you have an Alomomola with you, there'll be no need for a doctor or medicine.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
Generation IX.Violet: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.
